intro: Psychotria sycophylla, commonly known as the "false arrowroot," is a species of flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species, many of which are known for their ornamental and medicinal properties. The plant is characterized by its evergreen foliage and clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom throughout the year. It typically grows in humid, shaded environments such as tropical forests and is often found in lowland areas. Psychotria sycophylla is valued for its aesthetic appeal and has been used in traditional medicine for various purposes.
